article_title: Homelessness in Hawaii is worst in nation, defying image of paradise
article_text:
State has 487 homeless per 100,000 people, the nation’s highest rate per capita

Since 2010, the rise has come even as the national rate has fallen

Official says changes in public housing policy, mental health services have fueled the rise

article_metadata.news-keywords: Hawaii, Honolulu, homelessness, highest in nation
article_metadata.description: Homelessness in Hawaii has grown to the nation’s highest rate per capita, above New York and Nevada, according to federal statistics.
article_metadata.title: Homelessness in Hawaii is worst in nation, defying image of paradise | Miami Herald
